greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A329038(i) = A329038(j) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A329038, i.e., of function f(n) = A246277(A276086(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..32768
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A246277(n) = if(1==n, 0, my(f = factor(n), k = primepi(f[1,1])-1); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = prime(primepi(f[i,1])-k)); factorback(f)/2);
A276086(n) = { my(m=1, p=2); while(n, m *= (p^(n%p)); n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (m); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 11 2019
